    About Me - Eliyas Kidanemariam Abraha

    About Me

    I am Eliyas Kidanemariam Abraha, a master's student in the Erasmus Mundus Joint Master in Intelligent Field Robotic Systems (IFRoS), hosted by University of Girona (Spain) and Eötvös Loránd University (Hungary). I specialize in autonomous systems, perception, and AI for robotics.

    My expertise spans path planning, visual-inertial and LiDAR-inertial odometry, SLAM, and multi-sensor fusion using both Extended Kalman Filters (EKF) and factor graph optimization. I have hands-on experience in point cloud processing, feature-based scan matching, and map-based localization, with a focus on enabling robust navigation in GNSS-denied environments.

    I am currently a research intern at Saxion University of Applied Sciences, where I work on LiDAR-based mapping and localization. My focus lies in developing a robust LiDAR-Inertial localization system that operates reliably within a given prior map, leveraging factor graph optimization techniques. I also work as a robotics software intern at Farming Revolution GmbH, developing precision weeding systems through geographic data processing and optimal path generation for autonomous field robots.

    Driven by a passion for robotics and problem solving, I aim to develop scalable and intelligent systems that enhance autonomy across various environments.
